For the Lost and Found problem use sudo ( or "gksudo nautilus" to view it with the GUI )
gksudo just runs GUI programs as root
How is the Lost and Found folder preventing you from unmounting the partition?
If you get an error that a partition is mounted in gparted just right click it and choose umount
gksudo is a command you use in a terminal to run GUI applications as root, in a terminal ( or run dialog ) type: gksudo <whatever>
so how would i get root access to that folder to delete it?
sudo rm -r /whatever/folder/you/want/to/delete or to do it from the file browser run: gksudo nautilus
